model_data_base.model_data_base.LoaderWrapper¶

class model_data_base.model_data_base.LoaderWrapper(relpath)[source]¶

Bases: object

This is a pointer to data, which is stored elsewhere.

It is used by ModelDataBase, if data is stored in a subfolder of the model_data_base.basedir folder. It is not used, if the data is stored directly in the sqlite database.

The process of storing data in a subfolder is as follows: 1. The subfolder is generated using the mkdtemp method 2. the respective dumper puts its data there 3. the dumper also saves a Loader.pickle file there. This contains an object

with a get method (call it to restore the data) and everything else necessary to recover the data

  1. A LoaderWrapper object pointing to the datafolder with a relative

    path (to allow moving of the database) is saved under the respective key in the model_data_base

The process of loading in the data is as follows: 1. the user request it: mdb[‘somekey’] 2. the LoaderWrapper object is loaded from the backend sql database 3. the Loader.pickle file in the respective folder is loaded 4. the get-methdo of the unpickled object is called with the

absolute path to the folder.

  1. the returned object is returned to the user

__init__(relpath)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.
